title: Microbrewery Strategic & Quality Control Analysis
text:
ğŸº Microbrewery Strategic & Quality Control Analysis

Operations Optimization â€¢ Risk Modeling â€¢ Decision Analytics
A comprehensive analytics project combining financial modeling, Monte Carlo simulation, decision trees, linear programming, and risk assessment to evaluate the feasibility and production strategy of launching a microbrewery in Houston, Texas.





ğŸ“Œ Executive Summary
This project evaluates the launch strategy of a Houston-based microbrewery through a robust combination of quantitative modeling, risk simulation, and operational optimization.
Using data-driven decision frameworks, we assessed demand variability, defect rates, seasonal production cycles, and financial outcomes.
Key analytical components include:

Monte Carlo Simulation (1,000+ iterations) to evaluate risk and uncertainty in brewing output

Decision Tree Analysis to analyze strategic production alternatives

Linear Programming Optimization for production scheduling and ingredient allocation

Break-even and Profitability Modeling for investment feasibility

Hypergeometric Distribution for defect rate evaluation in microchip quality testing

This integrated approach resulted in a projected 15% ROI by Year 3, with enhanced visibility into risks, operational constraints, and market positioning.




ğŸ”§ Methods & Techniques

Simulation & Risk

Monte Carlo Simulation

Scenario Modeling

Hypergeometric Quality Control Tests



Optimization

Linear Programming (LP) for production planning

Constraint-based scheduling



Financial Modeling

Break-even analysis

Revenue projections

Cost modeling



Decision Frameworks

Decision Trees

Sensitivity Analysis






ğŸ’¼ Business Impact
This analysis provided a clear assessment of:

Optimal production volumes

Inventory control for seasonal demand

Minimizing operational losses due to microchip defects

Investment feasibility for microbrewery launch

Risk-adjusted financial planning

The combination of simulation, optimization, and forecasting led to a defensible, data-backed investment strategy for the microbreweryâ€™s launch.

title: Cruise Market Segmentation & Conjoint Analysis
text:
ğŸŒŠ Cruise Market Segmentation & Conjoint Analysis

Customer Insights â€¢ Preference Modeling â€¢ Strategic Targeting
A full analytical study combining K-means clustering, conjoint analysis, and behavioral segmentation to optimize product positioning and marketing strategy for the Caribbean cruise market.





ğŸ“Œ Executive Summary
This project analyzes customer behavior, preferences, and value drivers within the Caribbean cruise industry.
Using marketing analytics and machine learning techniques, we segmented passengers, identified high-value clusters, and evaluated consumer preferences for cruise amenities and voyage features.
The analysis enabled:

Identification of distinct customer personas

Prioritization of high-margin voyage features

Measurement of customer value through conjoint utilities

Insights for optimizing pricing, promotions, and product design

This is a strong example of applying data science to real-world marketing strategy.




ğŸ”§ Methods & Techniques

Clustering & Segmentation

K-means clustering

PCA dimensionality reduction

Behavioral grouping

Pattern recognition across voyage attributes



Conjoint Analysis

Utility scoring

Preference estimation

Attribute importance ranking

Market choice simulation



A/B Test Framework

Comparative variant testing

Conversion uplift measurement

Feature prioritization



Supporting Analytics

Exploratory data analysis (EDA)

Visualization & insight narrative

Market segmentation logic






ğŸ‘¥ Segment Profiles
Based on analysis, the cruise market was segmented into strategic personas:

1. Value-Focused Travelers

Price sensitive

Prefer shorter voyages

Budget cabins, essential amenities



2. Premium Leisure Seekers

Mid-to-high willingness to pay

Prefer upgraded rooms & premium dining

Respond well to bundled packages



3. Experience Maximizers

Prioritize premium excursions

Seek longer voyages

High relevance for luxury add-ons



4. Family & Multi-Guest Groups

Need multi-room accommodations

Value convenience features

Respond to child-friendly amenities

These personas form the basis for targeted marketing and product differentiation.





ğŸ’¼ Business Impact
The project provided actionable recommendations for:

Pricing strategy based on willingness-to-pay

Voyage design optimized for segment preferences

Promotional targeting for high-margin customer groups

Product bundling aligned with attribute utilities

Upsell pathways that improve revenue per guest

These insights can significantly improve booking conversions, customer satisfaction, and long-term profitability.

title: Airbnb Market Pricing & Predictive Modeling
text:
ğŸ¡ Airbnb Market Pricing & Predictive Modeling

Machine Learning â€¢ Regression â€¢ Clustering â€¢ Geospatial Analytics
A full statistical and machine learning analysis of the Airbnb market in Copenhagen, identifying key drivers of price, segmenting listings, and predicting price behavior using supervised and unsupervised learning methods.





ğŸ“Œ Executive Summary
This project analyzes Airbnb listing data from Copenhagen using a blend of predictive modeling, clustering, and classification methods.
The primary goals were to:

Identify key price drivers

Build a predictive regression model

Segment listings using PCA + K-Means

Classify property types using NaÃ¯ve Bayes, KNN, and Decision Trees

Provide data-driven recommendations for hosts and investors

The final regression model achieved an Adjusted RÂ² of 0.572, indicating strong explanatory power relative to typical real-estate datasets.




ğŸ”§ Methods & Techniques

Predictive Modeling

Multiple Linear Regression

Feature Selection

Multicollinearity Analysis

Residual Diagnostics



Clustering & Segmentation

PCA dimensionality reduction

K-Means Clustering

Cluster profiling & heatmaps



Classification Models

NaÃ¯ve Bayes

K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN)

Decision Tree Classifier

Confusion matrix & accuracy evaluation



Geospatial Analysis

Mapping price distribution across Copenhagen

Identifying high-value geographic clusters






ğŸ” Key Insights

ğŸ·ï¸ 1. Price Drivers Identified
The strongest predictors of price included:
- Room type
- Number of guests
- Location coordinates
- Host rating
- Cleaning fee
- Property size


ğŸ§© 2. Clustered Listing Profiles
Using PCA + K-Means, three main clusters emerged:
- Budget Listings â€“ small units, lower review scores
- Standard Listings â€“ mid-tier price & amenities
- Premium Listings â€“ large accommodations, strong ratings


ğŸ¯ 3. Classification Accuracy
Among classification methods tested, Decision Tree achieved the best balance of accuracy and interpretability.


ğŸ’¡ 4. Business Recommendations

Hosts can optimize revenue by adjusting price in line with identified predictors

Investors can target neighborhoods with highest value-to-cost ratio

Airbnb could implement cluster-based recommendation engines

title: About Me
text:
Hi, Iâ€™m Leo Hung Nguyen

Iâ€™m also a Teaching Assistant for AD599: Python & SQL for Business Analytics, where I support 70+ graduate students in mastering Python scripting, SQL querying, analytical workflows, and problem-solving techniques. This role has strengthened my communication, technical depth, and ability to guide others through complex analytical challenges.
